data.title: In a new interview for Momus, Amy Sillman and Jason Stopa talk about finding their ways to painting, the importance of ambivalence, the...
data.meta_description:
144 likes, 9 comments - momusart on May 6, 2024: "In a new interview for Momus, Amy Sillman and Jason Stopa talk about finding their ways to painting, the importance of ambivalence, the lure of alienated figures, and the complexity of sense-worlds.

Sillman reflects on how “terrible and inefficient abstraction might be—and how the world is also so terrible that maybe abstraction is perfect for now.” Quoting from a recent op-ed she published in the Washington Post, “Abstraction as ruin”, she questions: “What if abstraction is not the grand form it’s cracked up to be, but something we carry with us, half ineligible, half illegible, inefficient, and shabby”?

Ready the full text at momus.ca (link in bio).

@jasonstopa
#AmySillman
@gladstone.gallery

Images: 
1. Amy Sillman, Ghost, 2023-24. 
2. Amy Sillman, The Banana Tree, 2023. 
3. Amy Sillman, Ravenna, 2024. 
4. Amy Sillman, Albatross 1, 2024.
5. Amy Sillman, Afternoon, 2024.

All images courtesy the artist and Gladstone Gallery.".
